intro: Gaertnera crassiflora, commonly known as the thick-flowered gaertnera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Gaertnera crassiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
